home
Class Item

java.lang.Object
  home.Item

public class Item
extends java.lang.Object

This class represents an itemID in the smart home context. It aggregates the physical device which is provided through Grzegorz Lehmann's Model API and its view in the program. The itemID also stores Commands which provide functionality when interacting with the itemID within the gui. Items also carry a StateVisualizer which manages the appearance of the itemID depending On their state.

Version:
20120512
Author:
langenhagen

Constructor Detail

Item

public Item(java.lang.String name,
            org.sercho.masp.models.Context.PhysicalDevice device,
            Home home)
Main constructor.
Creates an item with the 3D object accordint to the physical device's type. Adds commands and state visualizers.

Parameters:
name - A friendly name as a String
device - The PhysicalDevice of this itemID.
home - The home tho which this item belongs to. It will not be used directly by the item but can be used by clients of the item.

public Item(java.lang.String name,
            org.sercho.masp.models.Context.PhysicalDevice device)
Constructor #2.
Creates an item with the 3D object accordint to the physical device's type. Adds commands and state visualizers. Sets the home to null.

Parameters:
name - A friendly name as a String
device - The PhysicalDevice of this itemID.
home - The home tho which this item belongs to.

setStateVisualizer

public void setStateVisualizer(StateVisualizer stateVisualizer)
Sets the state visualizer.

Parameters:
stateVisualizer - A StateVisualizer or NULL. If you set the parameter NULL, an DummyVisualizer will be installed automatically. This DummyVisualizer does in fact nothing, but avoids null-pointer exceptions.

public StateVisualizer getStateVisualizer()
Gets the state visualizer.

Returns:
The corresponding StateVisualizer

setView

public void setView(MT3DObject obj)
Sets the view. If necessary, registers DragProcessor, RotateProcessor and ScaleProcessor On the new view. Doesn't unregister the processors On the old view!

Parameters:
obj - An MT3DObject as the new view

setEditMode

public void setEditMode(boolean editMode)
Switches between the edit mode, in which you can translate and rotate the itemID and the interaction mode, in which you can interact with the itemID as defined in its command.

Parameters:
editMode - TRUE - sets edit mode
FALSE - sets interaction mode
